div.p: S. Linerus will report everything to you that I could have written.

He also has with him a copy of the proclaimed peace. Our people are preparing for Gasti's departure. I hope not too hastily. I am confined to bed due to erysipelas and can write no more; therefore, forgive me. I sent Felicem to Lausanne; there, Blasius, my son-in-law, received him. He left here on the 1st of September and arrived there on the 2nd. I also took care of sending his small belongings there.
He left a note with me, which I do not have at hand now, but I will send it to you shortly.
Farewell. May all your people be safe. Ours send their regards to you. Bern, 7th of September 1570 from our bed.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger the Elder, my honorable lord and dearest compatriot.
